availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George Washington McAdams (Hancock County boatman and tobacco merchant)

body.p: Hancock County, Kentucky, boatman and tobacco merchant. Indiana native. Married to Dorcas Comstock McAdams in Hancock County on August 7, 1840. Father of Josephine McAdams, Hester McAdams, Eugene P. McAdams, and Sam L. McAdams, Celest McAdams, and John C. McAdams. Owned three enslaved persons in 1850. Owned three enslaved persons in 1860. Merchant in Hancock County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
"Hon. G. W. M'Adams Dead," Courier-Journal (Louisville, Ky.), August 2, 1889.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County, Hawesville, p. 117.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County, Hawesville, p. 10.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County, Hawesville, p. 14.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Hancock County Marriages, Film #000495729, p. 23.
